Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonLorrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days early March. The staff was very helpful in all ways especially the young lady from Lithuania who was the guest relations manager. The hotel reminded us of a typical European pensione. Small, clean room but adequate and reasonably priced. Free internet was a must for us and worked very well. The location is in the old portion of the city and we walked to all the major sights. It would be a bit hard to find if you don't take a taxi to get there. The location immerses you in the working street life of the city and we enjoyed safely walking the back streets through the textile, shoe and purse districts. We would definitely go there again. Take the hotel business card with you when you go out so if you get lost you can get help getting back. Rooftop breakfast was included and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Marit H
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Istanbul, and loved the area of the Hotel Amber! It is a bit off the main tourist-route, but still within short walking distance to the main attractions.The hotel has nice and clean rooms, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. This is great value for money. The only reason why I can't give the hotel top rating is the breakfast. Nice and fresh bread, but the rest of the variety was a little dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “very nice ,hospitable staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: ayman123
Reviews.Content: amazing,really nice and hospitable staff would love to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Just Great...”
Reviews.Author: Downtown3512
Reviews.Content: My family,and I always wanted to go to Istanbul,Sultanahmet area to enjoy the ancient atmosphere,but we didn't know it would be that good.Wanted to thank the Amber staff to make our journey enjoyable,and gratefull.Whenever we needed any information for the city,or for anything they were there to help us. Our room was perfectly clean,and very specious for 3 of us.Breakfast area has a view of gorgeous sea,and my little 5 years old daughter even fed the birds,it was amazing.everything exceed my expectations,and I am very thankful to the staff. You can walk up to tram that takes you all the center points,or walk up to Sultanahmet area,nice walking,or go by the sea that is in only 5 min.walking distance,by the way if you like fish,you're not far from famous fish restaurants,just around the corners. They have a back yard with lot of flowers,and they do barbecue out there,very cozy place. We definitely are coming back to this place,cause we haven't done Istanbul yet,so much to see,we only stayed 3 nights,and it wasn't enough!!! Guys,we'll be back!Â  You are my favorite so far.Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable place!”
Reviews.Author: schranzkind
Reviews.Content: Friendlyness of the staff exceeded my expectations. Room was very clean, major sightseeing places are near and easy to reach. Responded promptly on my special wishes. Bed was very comfortable. Continental breakfast includes a view over the roofs to the ocean. I will be there in 3 weeks again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Ann H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on the 1st Feb. My husband and I travel a lot and this hotel provided exactly what we needed. A nice comfy bed in a clean room and good shower. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast that started us off for sightseeing. The location is about 15 minutes walking distance away from Sultanahmet and all the major sites. For the three days we were there we decided to walk to Eminionu which took about 45 mins. Staff were very helpful especially the young lady originally from Lithuania who provided us with walking directions to everywhere. :) Internet is also free which was a surprise to us seeing that you get charged at most hotels these days. Great hotel for a city break. :) Sue

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: lalaphil
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights. Room is small but clean qnd peaceful. The hotel is near the fish and meat restaurants so no worry on where to eat. It is also walking distance to some tourists spots the. The staffs at the reception are very friendly. Breakfast at the rooftop, awesome. Internet connection in the room is very important for me.

Reviews.Title: “APPROVED”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: Very good location, great employees such as 'Jacob' and his 'assistance'. I do recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Only one night thank - goodness.”
Reviews.Author: Qualitytraveller22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amber Hotel earlier on in the year because like quite a few people when we arrived at the sister hotel, The Empire Palace, we were told there was no room available. The common explanation is that there is a problem with the "booking system" so please be aware. The Amber Hotel and what is around this hotel is in my view perfectly captured by a fellow tripadvisor reviewer "springboard" who gave it a downbeat average rating. I cannot frankly go along with any of the reviews which place this hotel above an average rating. By the time we took stock of our situation we decide to have a shower, the bedroom room was tiny and looked inwards onto a pretty awful courtyard. The one thing that cheered us up was the fact that the hotel was just around the corner from a street of very nice fish restaurants. The following morning we were picked up by the hotel taxi and taken to the Empire Palace. Word of warning, if you decide to venture north towards the main centre please be very careful, the streets in my view look a little threatening.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Paavo57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a double room on the 3rd floor. Our room was quite small with tiny balcony to the street. Breakfast was good, staff friendly and service more than decent. The location is excellent but on Saturday night pretty noisy. Little extra: bottled water was free. Bed was not as soft as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jewelianna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in a triple room, which was actually a two-level two room duplex, great for our group of friends. The room was not extravagant but very comfortable. The bathroom was large compared to most in Europe, including the shower compartment. Bottled water was free every day in the minibar. Extra blankets and pillows were brought quickly, and room service was available even late night. The phones were out for a couple of days but the front desk staff was very helpful in making calls for us to help located the bags our airline lost. They were also eager to give recommendations for tours and restaurants as well as directions to sites. Breakfast in the rooftop dining room was a great way to start the day, with a variety of foods and drinks and spectacular water views. Location was pretty good, very close to a busy restaurant row, ATMs, and convenience stores. It's about a ten minute walk uphill from the hotel to the Grand Bazaar, maybe a little longer but less hilly to the Sultanhamet sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Wilfried R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights. Our room was on the second floor with windows to the back of the hotel. Rooms are small but clean and comfortably furnished. Bathroom reasonable size and complemetary water every day. A little noisy but therefore the location is great and fantastic restaurants in all price catagories within walking distance as well as many historical sites. The friendly and helpful staff made our stay in the hotel and our week in Istanbul a great and lasting exoerience. The in house BBQ is a winner for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: mebanana
Reviews.Content: This is just what you'd expect from a Best Western - clean, comfortable (if quite small) rooms, helpful staff and a good location. You can't drink the water from the tap so you are supposed to get fresh complementary water in the minibar each day, sadly this didn't always happen, but buying bottled water is very cheap in Istanbul so it wasn't really a problem. We would come here again, it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Weliked the kindness of the staff”
Reviews.Author: theorika
Reviews.Content: Very good situation for the historical sites. Rooms are smal but convenient and clean. Very kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant stay at the Hotel Amber.”
Reviews.Author: PandPNorthEastUK
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the friendliness of the staff, and when we had a problem with the air conditioning it was sorted as soon as it was possible. It was nice to be able to sit out on the roof terrace in the early mornings and evenings with the view of the sea od Marmara. Excellent location for transport by tram to the sites on the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “Face value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Buster1012
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Amber hotel for a week over Easter in april 2011. The hotel is well situated near all the great sights of the old city. The hotel is clean, the rooms are nice and well maintained, and the staff very helpful, smiling, service minded and flexible. We found that it was excellent value witin its class.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: zomarjee
Reviews.Content: I was extremely satisfied with everything, from start to finish and my stay in Istanbul couldnt have been better! The Manageress, Ceyilan was really helpfull, knowledgeable and friendly, as well as the Concierge, Nesim and Ersin. They really made us feel at home, gave us good advice on everything we needed to know, and catered our every need. Will definitely go there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the old town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ronver
Reviews.Content: We have spend a short city holidady in Istanbul in march 2011. We can recommend this hotel. Nice rooms, cleaned up daily, very kindly employees and and a beautifull view during the breakfast. The place of the hotel is in the old town. 10 min. walking to the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilde_gaeremynck
Reviews.Content: nice rooms very friendly staff good breakfast good location

Reviews.Title: “Good for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Lummerland123
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern room. Everything was working well. Quiet hotel, although Istanbul street noises go untli 2 in the morning. Windows keep lots of the noise outside. International guests. Good view from roof restaurant (whre a very good breakfast is served as well). You can also have an evening drink up there, watching the ships on marmara sea. Very helpful receiption desk, clever in flight reservations as well ! Not easy to find, but just around the corner of Kumkapi restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Small hotel with lots of Advantages”
Reviews.Author: Buncky3255
Reviews.Content: The Amber has the best service that I have ever experienced. Yakup, the main recepion person, looked after every detail of our stay. eg. Arrived after dark on Friday Sept.17, he suggested for us to have dinner there as only had BBQ on Fridays. we indicated that we were not that hungry so he suggested for us to share a dinner & the charge would also be less for the 1 dinner. He also said to have 1 serving of the main meat but as much of the wonderful buffet veggies as needed.The dinning area was decorated uniquely. The rooms were small but well furnished, comfortable bed, dressing table w/ mirror,TV,bar fridge, couple of chairs, well supplied clean washroom. The Breakfast Room was located on the top floor with views to the Sea of Marmara. Large choice of items (hot or cold) for breakfast. Yakup provided storage of 4 large bags for 1 night as we took a side trip with only our small bags. When we returned the following evening, we were taken to our rooms and our large bags appeared in minutes from the storage area. The location is very convenient, there is a walking street full of restaurants 1/2 block away. 3 short blocks to the seashore and the fish markets.About 5 blocks up the hill is the Grand Bazzar & the tram line that takes you to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapki Palace & The Cisterns. It's a nice walk rather than taking the tram to these. Yakup arranged the hotel van to take us to the pier for our cruise ship for a very economical price compared to a taxi. Next time we are in Istanbul we will stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing service EVER”
Reviews.Author: LoveJozi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with colleagues for one week. The rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. The area? I loved it. Heaps of character, and you get to see what Istanbul is really about. For the less adventurous, please go and stay next to the first tourist trap, or just go to Eurodisney instead. The neighbourhood is alive and vibrant, so if you are a light sleeper (like me), bring your earplugs. Apart from the noisy streets, it is such a nice base to see Istanbul from. If you like seeing more than just the average tourist would see, this is for you. What makes this hotel truly amazing? The staff. Nothing is too much for them. One morning my colleague wanted a bit more yoghurt. One staff member went out to buy extra! Jaylin and her team will never say no, and they will always be courteous, friendly and super-helpful. I am so glad we stayed here. It is a small hotel with a big focus on customer service. I have travelled around the world, and I have never seen a hotel team respond to queries with such a can-do attitude. Thanks Amber! (and also to the sister hotel Empire Palace)

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: springboard
Reviews.Content: Frankly this hotel is a disappointment. There is nothing outstandingly wrong with it but everything is a little worse than it needs to be. it's located in sultanahmet in a dingy and dirty backstreet. It is walking distance from the aya Sophia and topkapi but it's a twenty minute walk past plenty of similar hotels that you will wish you had booked. the reception is dark and uninviting and behind it is a dilapidated courtyard that reeks of neglect. We never saw anyone use it during our stay. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was also clean and there was an excellent shower. However, the room was tiny; I mean that you had to turn sideways to squeeze round from one side of the bed to the other. The window looked out over the rubbish strewn roofs surrounding you. The walls are paper thin which allows you to share the joy of your neighbours with the crying child with astonishing clarity. On top of which you can hear the busy street outside with cars honking etc We slept badly every night even with earplugs. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty with a reasonable view of the surrounding area. There is also good wifi throughout the hotel. But the place annoys in every detail. The sheets didn't cover the bed fully so they couldn't be tucked in and rucked up under you at night. They wouldn't give me a receipt when I checked out even though i asked. Nor would they give me a receipt for the bags I wanted to leave while we toured the city. Apparently I was just supposed to trust them. Perhaps if I was just a businessman needing a place to bed down for the night this hotel would be alright. There was, after all, nothing fundamentally wrong with it. But for a couple hoping to feel that the hotel was a sanctuary from the city it was utterly useless. In short, even though it cost us one night's stay, we checked out early and went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the old town”
Reviews.Author: emptynesters2007
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the old town within walking distance of all the sights, this is an excellent choice. The rooms are small but very well appointed with lots of little extras. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. Breakfast, served on the roof terrace, was more than adequate to see you through a day's sightseeing. The street outside can be noisy during the day - but you're not going to be there during the day. Just round the corner are a number of restaurants. The only disadvantage is the number of steps up to reception from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel, offering a Twenty Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Tesie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, if this is your first trip to Turkey, then allow for two things - (1) 15 Euros per person to buy a visa at the airport to enter the Country, then about 1.5 hours from flight landing to clearing through Visa buying and Passport Control - it is very slow. Also I would strongly advise using this Hotel's Airport Transfer Service - it is well worth it. If you are travelling under your own steam, then the hotel would be very very difficult to find and taxi drivers do tend to charge what they like, unless you lock them down. Now the Hotel - what can I say - on first inspection, the area is "very colourful", however, this competely changes at night when the main streets come alive. However, once you step into this hotel, you could be anywhere. First impression was that it was cool and smelt lovely as you go up the marble steps to the small Reception Area. Yakob and his team are shining stars - nothing is too much trouble for them. The hotel is spotless which is carried through to the beautiful bedrooms and equally shining bathrooms. I would recommend the hotels BBQ - 25 Euros, but it really good value for money and the meat is beautifully cooked. We had a room at the back of the hotel, so we did not suffer from any street noise, however our sleep quality did suffer due to the heat during our stay. Also, I cannot vouch for the quiteness if you have a room overlooking the streetside. Please don't be put off by the location of this hotel. Once outside at night, we wandered around and were not felt compromised in any way. On the contrary, the Turkish people who all patrol outside the restaurants are all looking to get you inside, but are good natured when you refuse, you just need to be firm but respectful. This hotel is also ideally situated for all the main attactions - there is a steep hill, but its not too bad, and once you are at the top, everthing is within walking distance, or the tram service is very good. I loved my stay in Istanbul - and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyonel

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with exceptionlly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hgsp2005
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel was very well situated for our purpose. We were able to walk to many of the cultural sites note our ages 70 & 75 so nothing a great distance. The proximity of the fish market and restaurants was indeed a bonus. All the staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but only if you're not paying the rack rates”
Reviews.Author: PeterR74
Reviews.Content: Good points Great roof top terrace, with an excellent spread for breakfast every morning. Also had a ground floor courtyard which was very pleasant to have a drink in, after a long day of sight seeing. Staff very friendly, but not very organized. 5 minute walk to the grand bazaar (up a very steep hill though). 10 minute walk to the sultanahmet area. Right next to the fish restaurant area. Bad points We were traveling with a young child and as they didn't have any spare cots, so we had to use a foldout bed, for which there was barely enough room for in our room. We arrived early in the morning from a long international plane flight and our rooms weren't available until midday. Luckily my mother was already there and we could use her room to freshen up in. We booked the hotel through a package tour place and payed a reasonable rate. We needed to stay one more day but the rate they quoted was much more than we were already paying.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Very Friendly Personel”
Reviews.Author: Soleymaniha
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. You can visit all the historic site in a few minutes walking and the Grand Bazar is almost two blocks away. The "tram" station is at the doorsteps, although the sound of the tram and the crowd in the main street will not be heard in the hotel. Mr. Yakup (the evening reception guy) is an asset for the hotel. He speaks very good English and with a nice sence of humour. He is very helpful, may be too helpful (!). He booked a restaurant for us and a limo, which we were amazed when we came back to hotek for rest that night! The sea food was very good and the restaurant owner was a true gentelman, offering us his limo to take us back to the hotel when he saw our little kid sleeping on the table!!! Bythe way, I should say this, that we were expecting a "hotel", not a 4-floor apartment with extremely small lift and very small lobby. The breakfast was very simple althoug Yakup said the small room (the hotel restaurant) is temporary and the main restaurant is under renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_103
Reviews.Content: Small comfortable hotel, rooms are clean and air conditioned.Friendly and helpful staff who spoke good English.Â  Location colourful but felt safe for myself and a friend - both female, even late at night.Â

Reviews.Title: “Not a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Benly9
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is in a noisy and unclean area. Upon arrival, the receptionist told us that our two triple rooms have been taken even though I made the reservation two weeks in advance. we were relocated to another hotel for two days. We waited for three hours before we could settle into our rooms. clean towels have to be called in for everyday. One good thing about it is that it is situated near several tourist attractions and mass transit systems. The breakfast offered a fair selection of choices. The staff was cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Noise protection is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: alm68
Reviews.Content: The main problem of this hotel is the noise protection, there is no at all. I could hear every word of people who lived in the next room and could not sleep. Also the windows and the door allow the noise enter. So, I could sleep only with tampons in my ears. The rest is not bad, not good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury when you least expected it”
Reviews.Author: ijazali
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for 3 nights. Its a street hotel very near the fish restaurants of kumpaki. You'd expect it to be just another boutique hotel, but Lo and Behold, the standards inside are 5 star. An extra comfy bed with glass showers and a sunny patio in the rear for drinks and meals. Hotel staff are very friendly and courteous. They didn't have a parking for my hired car but the valet guy parked it nearby in a secure parking lot 2 mins walk away, though it used to cost USD 8 per day. Around the hotel its a flurry of activity with ration and cafes. A very cultural ambience and best travelled on foot. The food in the many many many fish restaurants of Kumkapi round the corner is sumptious. Would stay again if they gave me a repeat visit discount. Oh yes and it has free Wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: HongKongHomer
Reviews.Content: While it wasn't super fancy, it was clean, comfortable, well-priced, and the staff was fantastic. It isn't in the posh neighborhood, but we liked that we could be close to areas that felt local as well as a short walk from the major historical sights and the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: The_4_Frenchs
Reviews.Content: A very good stay in this hotel. the Restaurant ( where we took the breakfast) offer an amazing view on the sea. We were in a room/ duplex for 4 personns, it was very clean and confortable. Good localisation near the Grand Bazar, Sultanhamet , blue mosquee etc... The personnal was very nice and available at everytime. their advices allowed us to enjoy this trip.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great value.”
Reviews.Author: Teri0707
Reviews.Content: My 21 year-old daughter and I stayed at the Best Western Amber Hotel last week and truly enjoyed ourselves. The manager, Yakub, was extremely kind and accommodating. We found the hotel to be very clean and a nice respite from the streets of Istanbul. A couple of the things we liked most were the complimentary breakfast in the rooftop restaurant and the availability of internet usage. We were traveling light, so we didn't bring a laptop with us, but the computer at the hotel was available almost every time we wanted to use it, which was a lot, and didn't cost much. It was a euro for 20 minutes, if I recall. The beds were fine, the room clean, and the thermostat worked, which is always a plus. To get to the Grand Bazaar and the tram that would take you to other sights of interest, it was a walk of a few blocks uphill. We didn't find it to be an issue, but if you are not 100% ambulatory, you may want to take a cab. However, the entire city of Istanbul is hilly, so beware. As is the case with much of what we saw of Istanbul, many nice hotels are interspersed throughout neighborhoods with ramshackle buildings. This is the case with the Best Western Amber. I would go back to the Best Western Amber and I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this comfortable hotel where the service was great.”
Reviews.Author: YCPManchester
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the good rate we were offered through booking.com but it was a very good choice. It was a well maintained,clean and comfortable with spacious, pleasant rooms. The service all round was excellent with a very good breakfast served in a top of the building terrace with views of the Bosphorus. The only disadvantage was that the location was less than perfect. The nearby fish restaurants are very noisy (and expensive but lively if you like that kind of thing) and the must see sights are a 20/ 30 minute walk away. All round a good choice we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff served us at this clean nice little hotel in old town”
Reviews.Author: ruskoresor
Reviews.Content: Our first visit in Istanbul was nice. One of the reasons for that were the hotel Amber and its friendly staff. Especially Mr. Nesim Htes at the reception was very helpful and kindly gave us good recommendations for tourist attractions. We stayed only for four days, but because of his recommendations, we made the most of the short stay and got to see many nice sights. The room was nice and clean and big enought for 3 persons. The breakfast was ok. The hotel was situated quite close to Grand Bazaar for example. -Three ladies from Finland-

Reviews.Title: “Small, pleasant hotel in a busy area.”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: There isn't much to add to the previous reviews of this hotel. It's a small property, although relatively recently refurbished. It's not sharp, cutting edge or designer - the rich furnishings, cream colours, dark wood and marble might not be to everyone's taste! My room was reasonably spacious, with a decent bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful, and the location good - the local area has many seafood restaurants, being so close to the fish market. The train (a short walk from the hotel) will bring you to the city centre in approximately 10 minutes - so as locations go, it's not bad, especially for the price. There was a reasonable range and quality of foods available for breakfast. My biggest complaint? The in-room safe wasn't big enough to take a standard size laptop - which seemed a bit odd. Still, if you're looking for a reasonably priced, intimate hotel in Istanbul, you could do worse than the Best Western Amber.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: annemai
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the comfortable, the staff helpful and friendly. The breakfast was ok, nothing special. Heavy traffic outside late iin the evening. good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cosy & clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Evgenia2403
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Amber hotel! We especially liked the restaurant on the roof with the view on the Sea of Marmara, breakfasts there are a great start for the day in Istanbul. The staff is very friendly, rooms are clean, everything that is necessary is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful front desk staff!”
Reviews.Author: DennisI
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in Instanbul (first-time visit) and were pleased with the newness and cleanliness of the Hotel Amber. The best thing was the staff, especially Jacob on the front desk who was incredibly helpful recommending sites, calling taxis, etc. On short notice, he managed to get us one of the last tables in the fantastic Galata Tower for Valentine's Day dinner! Likewise, housekeeping surprised us on Feb. 14 by strewing paper roses and chocolate hearts on the bed. Very sweet. About the only negative is that Kumkapi is a crowded neighborhood with not many tourist hotels, and so taxi drivers often had trouble finding it, but hopefully as time goes by, they will eventually become more familiar with Kumkapi and this very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Highly Recommend to Everyone”
Reviews.Author: mayhemdiva
Reviews.Content: This wonderful newly renovated hotel is situated in the heart of old ISTANBUL. This was my third visit to Istanbul and will definitely stay here again. Great Location, excellent food choices all around and in hotel restaurant at very reasonable prices. Within easy walking distance of every attraction, the bazaar, topkapi palace and Aya Sofia. Staff excellent, rooms perfect and very well fitted out with every convenience. Would rate as one of the Best Hotels I have ever stayed in in 32 years of travelling. You will not go wrong booking to stay here. They will also organise anything you require at a reasonable and fair price regarding tours or transport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosiepickle
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the airport on the asian side which was miles away from the centre of Istanbul. We shared a hotel shuttle bus which cost 70TL single fare for two people. Our hotel was nice, very clean and the staff were very friendly indeed. I would say it was more 3star rather than 4star. Breakfast was included...scramble eggs, boiled eggs, turkish sausage, cheese, ham, breads, olives, cereals etc etc etc! The area was described as "colourful". It was very run down and I was quite disappointed when we arrived. We ate in a fish restaurant around the corner who charged us a fortune for two kebabs and wine. ALWAYS ask for prices in advance when ordering food or drink. We were ripped off in nearly every restaurant we ate in. Istanbul is a beautiful city, we were just unlucky as regards to where we ate. Bit of advice....avoid tourist cafes and restaurants! The food was not fresh, processed and poor value. Opt for local smaller eateries, street vendors and back street kebab shops! Much tastier and cheaper! The street kebab we ate on the last night at 4TL was ten times tastier than the steak we ate in a 5star roof top restaurant! If you are female travellers, be prepared for the attention from local men. Although mainly harmless banter and flirting, it does become annoying after a while! We felt we were the only blondes in the city! But good fun never the less.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bosas1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the building is old but recently renovated so everything is beautiful and quaint. The location was a little farther than we expected from the train station, we walked there and the street was a steep downhill. The next day we opted to take a taxi rather than go uphill on the street (which is all cobblestone and was hard on our luggage). Staff is very friendly and responsive. The room we got was great, we had 4 people and it was divided into an upstairs and downstairs so there was a bit of privacy. The only issues we had were that the heat in the downstairs room didn't work as well as upstairs, and the water for the shower was lukewarm, it would have been nice if everything was warm/hot. But other than that we were happy with it. The continental breakfast is great as well, with a beautiful view of the water, and good coffee and good bread and breakfast foods.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: JoeMemphis_TNUSA
Reviews.Content: Despite this being a Best Western brand hotel, this is actually the renovated Amber Hotel. And the renovation is a great success. The rooms are not large but they have every conceivable amenity--including modern air conditioning. Very comfortable mattress and pillows; highest quality linens. Bountiful, complimentary breakfast--including hot items( I wish they had bottled water with breakfast but that is a matter of personal preference). And, as you would expect with a boutique hotel, an outstanding staff--most notably Nesim who seems to be at the front desk whenever you need something. Nesim is a perfect gentleman who truly likes working at this hotel--and it shows in his extra effort to make sure you enjoy your stay. This hotel requires a walk to the tram but there is so much shopping(this hotel is in the shoe district) that you dont notice the walk...and, if you prefer, taxis are very cheap and readily available. Wireless is FREE throughout the hotel--room, restaurant, everywhere). I did not take my netbook and unfortunately the hotel's 'public' internet terminal did not work during my stay so I was 'forced' to use the internet cafe down the street(about 50 yds) --for 75 Cents an hour. I was VERY pleasantly surprised and pleased with the Best Western Amber.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: STEVEFR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated within walking distance of Sultanahmet and many other tourist areas like the Topkapi palace and mosques. The area is slightly hilly and would be a 5 min walk uphill to the tram station where you can get to many points in Istanbul from. If arriving on Easyjet from London you will arrive at Sabiha Gokcen Airport which is a long distance from the Hotel. It can be done via public transport but very difficult. Taxi is most expensive so best to take the airport shuttles direct to hotel. With a little bargaining in the terminal you can probably get it for a price of TRL50 (EUR30) at a push. TRL60 seemed to be the more common fare. Though I do notice the Hotel website quoting EUR70 for 1-3 passengers total. From Istanbul you can probably arrange a lower rate back from one of the many agents in the tourist areas offering airport transfer. The hotel is situated minutes from a group of dozens of restaurants. Both touristic and local. The menu in all seemed much the same type of seafood. The area around the hotel appeared to be safe and whilst a little dark at night in some side streets still not threatening as in some cities. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms and public areas kept very clean. Bottled water was supplied daily free in the fridge. Breakfast is taken in a balcony on the roof offering views across the harbor and surrounding neighborhood. Food choice and quality was just OK but not extensive. TV channel choice in English was extremely limited. Rooms are slightly smallish but as per standard of most medium range European hotels. Comfortable and functional but not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pleasant staff, very good value”
Reviews.Author: Xerx1
Reviews.Content: We had a family room - double bed upstairs and twin beds and bathroom downstairs so lots of space. I thought it was very good value. The location is great for all the main sights so we could walk/take tram to them all. Just around the corner is a group of restaurants specialising in fish but also serving meat, veggies. The hotel also has its own restaurant at similar prices and also produced a good breakfast as part of the room rate. The rose jam tastes like Turkish delight! . I managed to arrive minus my suitcase and the staff went out and bought me a toothbrush and then made several calls on my behalf to the airport to try and locate it for which I was grateful. They were always very helpful. The tea making was not in the room on arrival but came as soon as requested as did extra pillows etc. We took the hotal shuttle to/from the airport - it was a little beaten up and the driver spent a long time on his mobile on the way in but drove less erratically on the return trip. That was my only slight complaint as the rest of the hotel experience was very good. We found the hotel on Trip Adviser originally. It seemed to be very new although is in an old building over a bank. the views are a bit ramshackle but that is old Istanbul for you.There are lots of other Best Westerns also near the main sights and would eb worth checking out oif this is full.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: oriflame5
Reviews.Content: I liked the food, service and people there. They were so nice and polite. Room was neat. Next time I would like to stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “I also love Istanbul thanks to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mindthevaly
Reviews.Content: Small, very clean and confortable rooms. The personnel is really friendly and it seems to be at home. The hotel has got a perfect location, near the main turistic places. The best thing is the terrace of the hotel, which gives a wonderful view on wonderful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hydraulicnewdelhi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amber was a very good hotel, it was neat and clean and staff was very good and helping. The best thing about the hotel is it is situated in Sultan Ahmed area and a city centre, you have cabs, trams and metros easily available. The only problem which I faced was of vegeterian food being a vegeterian it was difficult to get the food of my choice. I request hotel people to have some good vegeterian Indian food so that travellers like us do not face much problem Regards Saket

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Ottoman building in upcoming neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: nolatNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: The Amber is beautifully updated and renovated. Quality materials, such as gorgeous marble and parquet floors are abundant throughout. In typical Best Western fashion, good standards of accommodation are adhered to. Rooms are small, but functional, with good quality mattresses, linens and modern, nice decor with Ottoman touches and newly updated bathrooms. The location of the hotel, in a rapidly becoming gentrified neighborhood, down the hill from the Grand Baazar is good for those people who do not have to be in the midst of the tourist hubbub. That being said, it is only a 15 minute walk to Sultanahmet and a 5 minute walk up the hill to the Grand Baazar and the modern tram line connecting Kabatas with Zeytinburnu. You can use this tram to get to many of Istanbul's attractions, including, Sultanahmet, Dolmabahce Palace, the Galata tower and neighborhood, Taksim and the docks from where many of the tour boats cruising the Bosphorus depart., amongst others. The top terrace of the hotel has magnificent views of the Sea of Marmara and is adjacent to the restaurant area, where the ample and very good complimentary breakfast is provided. The most valuable asset of the Amber hotel is the wonderful staff. Nargiza, Jacob and Nesim at the front desk are charming and knowledgeable, with a commitment to make their guests feel welcome and efficiently tackling any request. The housekeeping staff maintains the rooms in an impeccable state of cleanliness and the waiting staff is again a credit to this efficiently run small hotel. The Turkish people are possibly some of the friendliest and helpful in the world and I can say this, because I have travelled a lot and the staff of the Amber a credit to ALL Turks. I would gladly stay at the Amber hotel again and look forward to seeing Nargiza, Jacob, Nesim and the rest of the staff, again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value, Great Service what else could you want?”
Reviews.Author: nhill2
Reviews.Content: So my friends and I went to Istanbul for a trip. We didn't really do a lot of research before we got there so we ended up making a random one night hotel reservation from the airport for this 5 star hotel that we got a really good deal on. Well, apparently the criteria for star rating does not match our own, the service there was rude and lacking, so we were happy we only made a reservation for one night. We then implemented the same method and made a one night reservation at the Best Western Hotel Amber. Even though, we were going to be in Istanbul for a total of four more nights, we figured we wanted the option of switching hotels if this one didn't pan out like the other. Boy were we surprised. The people were really nice to us and made us feel very welcome. I know personally, I was a little wary at staying at a Best Western, but it was very pleasant. They spoke English (which is not a given in Istanbul) and were very helpful with whatever request you have. They also provide free wi-fi and bottled water. The location is nice, you can walk to all the top sights and it's not far from the airport, but what really stands out is the service. Remember, we have a "5 star" to compare it to and I would pick this every time. Just be sure to know the name of the neighborhood for the cab driver (it's Kumkapi) because that's the only way to find the hotel. Addresses mean nothing in Istanbul and apparently, they're never heard of Urban planning. The rooms are a little on the small side, but that's the way most of Europe is anyway. Besides, how much time are you really going to spend in your hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: anoucka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Amber, Istanbul, in December 2009. The staff was quite gently and always ready to give us the informations we needed. Despite the fact that the room was not very big, it was cosy and always well cleaned, as well as the bathroom. The hotel is located in Kumkapi, in Sultanhamet, in the center of Istanbul. It is surronded by lots of traditional fish restaurants were you can have a nice dinner for a good price, and walk by at night. You have also lots of small traditional conveniente stores nearby for anything you need. In my opinion, the location is perfect to have a better contact with the real life of the people that live in Istanbul - it is quite different from an Hotel in Taksim, for instance, that is a location where there are mainly hotels for tourists and shopping streets. We took about 10 minutes to reach the Grand Bazar by foot, so it's really close to the center of the city. The street that leeds to Grand Bazar is a bit steep, but if you don't mind walking, it's ok :)

Reviews.Title: “Good vs. Bad”
Reviews.Author: mmgarhy
Reviews.Content: The staff in Amber Hotel are very Friendly and helpful. The rooms are too small yet clean and tidy. The baby bed we ordered was in a bad condition so we were forced to make our baby to sleep between us on our bed :)

Reviews.Title: “I 'll be back”
Reviews.Author: gayrat
Reviews.Content: Istanbul and its people are gorgeous! Amber is a cozy home - you never feel yourself a foreigner! J Thank you for a good service! Iâ€™ll be back! J

Reviews.Title: “Amber hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saylesha
Reviews.Content: It was nice stay. Nothing negative to say about service and staff. Sufficient breakfast, clean rooms (mine had a view to Marmara Sea), good location. Turkish food in the restaurant was delicious and the staff of the restaurant was very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lovely terrace, clean and new”
Reviews.Author: shortsean
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this hotel. The rooms are clean (but the decoration is a little bit cheesy), the breakfast on the rooftop terrace was OK, the free wifi in the rooms was good enough for me to use Skype, and there are great seafood restaurants just around the corner. The staff were really nice & helpful, and knowledgeable. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, if I was to stay around the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Very homely and friendly hotel and very clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonVenus
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very pleasant, the staff, especially the reception staff were very friendly and very knowlegable about the tours we took and were able to give us good advice where to go. The hotel was very clean and nothing was too much trouble. The only draw back was the noise from the main road as we were located at the front of the hotel. The rooms were a bit small but bearable as we were out all day. The breakfast was quite basic but plentiful. Would definately stay there again but would request a room at the back of the hotel. Good location, 20 mins walk to Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia, Grand Bazaar. Great Memories. X

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Amber Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ciftegelinler Caddesi 3 | Kumkapi, Istanbul 34126, Turkey
